titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 581) expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding rates of compensation for civilian employees and members of the uniformed services of the United States.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-454, by Mr. Linder.

Rule provides for consideration of H. Res. 581 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 163.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 585.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/31/2004--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.Res. 581 (expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding rates of compensation for civilian employees and members of the uniformed services of the United States).
